column4: hi, ive got a problem with my other account, whenever i try to login, i have an error
oh, let me find the error message
arg, i cant find it.. it had a Unable to open /home/jean/.gnome2: Permission Denied
and that happened after i changed Permissions to the home folder /home/jaen
ive tried sudo chown -A jean:jean /home/jean and nothing happened
What was that supposed to accomplish? (chown doesn't have a -A param)
it was supposed to change the Permissions on the home folder of my other user account
(That's recursively change all ownership in that dir)
thanks.. well, i tried that, and i still get the same error
An error? I thought you said nothing happened...
What are the perms on /home/jean/.gnome2 then?

if i remember well, i had changed the home permissions once to 744 or something like that, then it kept me telling at login that they should be 644, so i changed them to 644.. and now i get that error
Yes. 644 is okay for a file, but NOT for a directory. It means you can't cd into it. Set it to 755. (chmod 755 /home/jean/.gnome2)
i typed that command and i still get the same error :S
i mean /home/sinclair. but nothing happened, am i doing something wrong?
